column8: Gerakan has submitted names of 50 potential candidates, half of whom are new faces, to the Prime Minister to be fielded in the next general election.Party president Datuk Seri Mah Siew Keong (pix) said the candidates have been working as Gerakan area coordinators in their respective areas for the past two years."They have been working hard at ground level and they have been touching base with their respective constituents and I am happy they are making serious efforts to bring Gerakan to a higher level in the next general election."We have solved our internal differences and now we are working as one to face the challenges with our other component members," he told newsmen at a Gerakan retreat titled "Political Brainstorming on General Election Preparation" Saturday.Mah said he predicted that Gerakan would do fairly well in the polls and would pass the acid test as one of the political parties to be reckoned with.On another issue, he dismissed talk of a rift between Prime Minister Datuk Seri Najib Tun Razak and his deputy Datuk Seri Dr Ahmad Zahid Hamidi after the appointment of Datuk Seri Hishammuddin Hussein as Special Functions Minister.He said he knows both Hishammuddin and Dr Ahmad Zahid well and there is no problem between them.Those spreading lies are unhappy with Barisan Nasional and that the coalition partners are gaining popularity, he added.http://www.thestar.com.my/news/nation/2017...4vrTA2Obfkm1.99
